result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary K Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes:
Per order of the Court, restitution set at zero.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mary K Schmidt

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Resolution reached; State agrees not to charge WCSD Incident #15-26617.  Statements on restitution.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.    Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State. New charges are pending. Req. adj. to attempt resolution of all cases.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Atty Alyssa Armbrust appearing for Def.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Defendant has new charges pending.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  No offer; adjourned for pretrial.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
No contact with Eddies Lake House

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Alyssa Armbrust State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.   Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court sets $500 sig bond.  SPD will represent.  Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.
